page.title: 15The Garway Questionnaire
page.content: We sent out questionnaires to the 92 houses in our 12 square kilometre patch. The only places left out were those known to be empty, holiday homes or derelict. 59 of these sheets have been returned. One other was handed back completely blank because the person who received it thought it was a Government plot to find out personal information about her. It included a housing survey, a population and age distribution survey and a shopping survey. Two of us went round delivering them with the school secretary. We could not deliver at one farm because the dogs were too fierce, so we sent that form by post.The milkman collected about a dozen of the completed forms, and Mrs Smith at the Post Office collected about 30. The remainder were brought in individually.
